subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new font: Suave
msgSnippet: ... Neat! Since some aspects of fonts can t be recovered when opening them with a font editor, have you considered putting your sources (FontForge .sfd, say)
messageBody:
On Nov 2, 2013, at 7:58 PM, scott@... wrote:



Dear All,


I just uploaded an OpenType font I made that I named Suave. It has kerning, and some additions, which you might find useful. 

You are free to use whatever features of it you want, or modify it in whatever way you want. Bear in mind that if you want to change its keyboard mapping, you'll have to update the kerning pairs to account for that (or delete them, if you prefer). It's now in the Fonts folder of the Files section, together with a document which explains the rationale for some of its special features, and which shows its keyboard layout. The font is optimized for American English spelling. It is not a Unicode font -- I chose not to go that route for personal reasons. I hope it will be of use to some of you. 

Neat!

Since some aspects of fonts can't be recovered when opening them with a font editor, have you considered putting your sources (FontForge .sfd, say) online with a suitably clear open-source license (MIT, say) or public-domain dedication? GitHub's been fairly handy for that sort of thing for Abbots Morton Experiment, even though I've had to pause its development.
